intro: Jacquemontia rojasiana, commonly known as the Andean moonflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, nocturnal blooms that open at night. The plant produces trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale lavender, with a strong, sweet fragrance. It thrives in cool, high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
